bibl.title: Legal aspects of dispute resolution in Late Antiquity. The case of P. Mich. XIII 659
bibl.seg: Marzena Wojtczak, Legal aspects of dispute resolution in Late Antiquity. The case of P. Mich. XIII 659.

Offers a legal analysis of P. Mich. XIII, 659, published in 1977, which concerns a dispute settled by means of mesiteia (i.e. mediation / arbitration). A plausible reconstruction of events is provided, which allows insight into the numerous correlations between the institutions as well as regulations known from the law on the one hand, and the legal practice as demonstrated by the papyri on the other.
